image.altText: A toddler strapped into a pram.

items.synopsis: The death of 17-month-old Adelaide toddler Ronan, two days after an alleged assault left him with head injuries, is now being treated as a murder, with police focusing on time the toddler spent in the care of family friends. WARNING: This story contains details readers may find distressing.

title.children: Death of 'beautiful little boy' triggers murder investigation by SA Police

image.altText: Stills of video which played a role in the Australian's four month investigation

items.synopsis: The collective says it has been dumped from the Indigenous Art Code without "regard to due process" after vision surfaced showing a white woman painting on an Aboriginal artist's canvas.

title.children: APY Art Centre Collective dumped from body regulating Indigenous art

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: SA Ombudsman Wayne Lines

items.synopsis: The state's independent watchdog Wayne Lines has investigated the Department for Education's handling of an alleged sexual assault at a South Australian high school.

title.children: High school failed to adequately support student who was allegedly sexually assaulted, ombudsman finds

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair outside courts.

items.synopsis: A man left with a significant brain injury after being attacked with a golf club at his home by a parolee who was looking for the previous occupant delivers a victim impact statement to the Adelaide District Court.

title.children: 'You are evil', wife tells repeat offender who used golf club to attack her husband

image.altText: Busy city street with police cars blocking off crime scene in Sydney's Bondi Junction

items.synopsis: Convicted drug kingpin Alen Moradian is believed to have been shot in an underground car park. Two cars, one of which was burnt out, have been found in nearby areas.

title.children: Police say underworld figure shot dead in car in Sydney's east was 'major player with a big target'

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair sits in a room and smiles

items.synopsis: Tasmania police say they are concerned for the welfare of a Belgian tourist after her car was found at a remote tourist track.

title.children: Police find car of missing Belgian tourist at waterfall track car park

image.altText: Satellite Image north west cloud band

items.synopsis: A strong kink in the subtropical jet stream is causing an unusual hit of tropical rainfall to spread across the country.

title.children: Rare dry season downpours begin across Australian outback, as cloud band spreads toward eastern seaboard

image.altText: Six men in camo uniform stand in formation. At the front, Caesar speaks to the camera

items.synopsis: Wagner's mutiny may be over, but from secret locations inside Russia and Ukraine, guerilla groups are dodging Moscow's crackdown on dissidents to sabotage Putin's plans and help Ukraine win the war.

title.children: Putin may have dealt with the Wagner threat, but another group of militants are threatening to bring him down

image.altText: men walking

items.synopsis: On Chinese social media, users referred to the Wagner chief by using the names of historical Chinese rebels to share their views on China's heavily censored internet.

title.children: Beijing downplays Wagner mutiny as experts say China might re-evaluate partnership with Russia

image.altText: a woman stands in front of vacant block with her two small children

items.synopsis: One young family's dream to own their own home edges closer to reality after their local council offers a rates rebate.

title.children: After a lifetime of renting, this family may soon afford a place to call their own

image.altText: A man and a woman looking up to a mandarin tree. The woman is holding two mandarins in her hands.

items.synopsis: Translating agricultural information into different languages is a game changer for people like Navjot Singh's parents who never hear it directly from the source.

title.children: Punjabi citrus growers access information in own language for the first time

image.altText: Hasti Masoumi  sits in front of portraits of her husband and son.

items.synopsis: A young mother who lost her son and husband at one of Sydney's popular beaches is calling for more to be done to warn about the dangers of rock fishing.

title.children: Young mum warns of rock fishing dangers after losing husband and son

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, a woman with blonde hair and blue eyes, glances to the right.

items.synopsis: A week after the former High Court justice who leads the Office of the Special Investigator sensationally called for it to be disbanded, Victoria's Attorney-General Jaclyn Symes has confirmed it will close.

title.children: Special investigative office probing Lawyer X scandal to be shut down with no charges laid

image.altText: Various electronic appliances with a young girl on a orange backdrop

items.synopsis: In some states energy prices will rise 25 per cent at the start of the month. Here are some ways to soften the blow.

title.children: Electricity prices are going up from July. Here are some free or cheap ways to save power in every room

image.altText: The new Wulanda convention centre in Mount Gambier.

items.synopsis: The City of Mount Gambier says the Wulanda Recreation and Convention Centre is a success, despite power bills being double what it expected.

title.children: Surging power cost slams recreation centre now facing bills of more than $100,000 a month

image.altText: Jennifer Howard holding a small dog

items.synopsis: An Adelaide not-for-profit organisation that helps struggling pet owners says the housing crisis has pushed demand for its services to record levels, forcing it to turn some people away.

title.children: Animal shelters inundated as SA pet owners seeking rentals make 'heartbreaking' choices

image.altText: One basketballer shoots and another attempts to spoil.

items.synopsis: Seventeen years after she was part of a golden moment with the Opals, basketballer and four-time Olympian Laura Hodges has stepped back onto the court.

title.children: This former Opal couldn't resist the temptation of another shot at glory

image.altText: A graphic of proposed flight paths for day arrivals and departures.

items.synopsis: The long-awaited preliminary flight paths for Western Sydney Airport are now public and residents can use an online tool to determine the noise impacts over their properties.

title.children: Flight paths revealed for new multi-billion-dollar Sydney airport

image.altText: Singer Taylor Swift wears a sparkly dress and boots while singing on stage

items.synopsis: The Victorian government has declared Taylor Swift's Melbourne tour a major event, meaning ticket scalping laws will apply to protect fans from being ripped off when she comes to the city in February next year.

title.children: Victorian government spells trouble for ticket scalpers as Taylor Swift's Melbourne tour declared 'major event'

image.altText: An old grainy photo of a man in a top hat crouched before two toddlers

items.synopsis: For 40 years, a cardboard box sat unopened under a house. Inside, were  not only precious memories of a family but a unique glimpse into life in the 1930s and 1940s.

title.children: Paul found a box with '2km worth of film' under his parents' house. Now it is a national treasure

image.altText: An old black and white newspaper with 'black hand menace' as the headline with a black hand on the page

items.synopsis: For years, Vincenzo D'Agostino terrorised and extorted Italian migrants across Far North Queensland as leader of the mafia group the Black Hand. His rule was a defining period for the regional Italian community, but one fact remains unsolved — who turned the tables, and murdered him?

title.children: The Black Hand reigned with fear for almost 10 years in north Queensland. This is how its leader was brought undone

image.altText: A woman looks out of her first-storey window as flood water laps at her staircase, her whole yard covered in brown water.

items.synopsis: Key recovery bodies cannot seem to agree on how many flood-damaged homes in the NSW Northern Rivers will be eligible for a buyback, raising or retro-fitting offer.

title.children: Flood-affected community facing 'greatest fears' as scope of home buyback scheme in doubt

image.altText: Tiger shark feeding frenzy off Queensland's Fraser Coast

items.synopsis: About 50 tiger sharks have been filmed in an "exciting spectacle" feeding on the remains of a humpback whale that is believed to have died from natural causes off the Wide Bay coast.

title.children: Shark feeding frenzy off Queensland coast signals 'healthy ecosystem', researcher says

image.altText: The PwC logo is shown on an office building.

items.synopsis: In a sublime combination of breathtaking arrogance and dazzling ineptitude, the Australian arm of global accounting giant PwC has managed to turn a possible crime into a national crisis and then allowed it to evolve into a catastrophe, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Can a $1 deal save PwC or will it follow Arthur Andersen into oblivion?

image.altText: Terror-accused in custody being led onto a plane.

items.synopsis: Agim Ajazi travelled into Syria with an intention to "overthrow the Syrian government by force" and "establish a state government by Sharia law", the Queensland Supreme Court heard.

title.children: Radicalised foreign fighter who joked about beheadings jailed for eight years

image.altText: Meaghan Louise Rose, who died in a fall at Point Cartwright in 1997, holding a scroll in an undated photo

items.synopsis: Meaghan Louise Rose's body was found at the bottom of the Point Cartwright cliffs on the Sunshine Coast in 1997.

title.children: Police say 70yo man spoken to over woman's cold case murder is missing

image.altText: A man in a dark suit wearing a football club's blue and white scarf waves at a crowd.

items.synopsis: The decision comes after a WA judge ruled Cable sexually abused a young girl, starting from when she was aged just 12.

title.children: Barry Cable removed from AFL Hall of Fame after 'horrific nature' of sexual abuse revealed in court

image.altText: Artwork of a group of people standing on a road with fire burning around them, and the words "Broken Roads".

items.synopsis: The vast West Australian Wheatbelt becomes home to a dystopian power struggle in this new Aussie video game tackling topics like survival, politics and moral philosophy.

title.children: Fallout meets Mad Max: The new dystopian video game set in the Aussie outback

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

items.synopsis: A Queensland nurse has successfully sued the Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service following a workplace injury in 2016.

title.children: Nurse awarded $1.6m after injury from avoiding thrashing patient

image.altText: Two ornate chairs near a small round table in an ornate room at the Versailles Palace in France

items.synopsis: The Palace of Versailles reopens the private rooms of France's last queen, after five years of intricate restoration.

title.children: Marie Antoinette's Versailles apartment reopens to the public after five years of restoration

image.altText: A small helicopter with damaged body and bend blades sit in bushland.

items.synopsis: Australia's national transport safety watchdog is concerned there are issues "relating to the status of evidence available" for its safety investigation that has embroiled celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright in an unfolding court battle.

title.children: Federal police asked to investigate possible criminal charges over helicopter crash that killed Chris 'Willow' Wilson

image.altText: woman standing on a beach with a surfboard

items.synopsis: A grassroots push by surfer Lucy Small has seen a Gold Coast event flooded with female competitors in an effort to get an equal prize pool, but the Kirra Klassic director says that has politicised the event.

title.children: 'The girls are not particularly good': Surfing competition defends decision not to hold women's open division

image.altText: Five women in colourful dresses sitting together and laughing.

items.synopsis: Worship, sacrifice and gatherings are the essence of any Eid celebration so here's when it's happening and where you can join in the festivities where you are.

title.children: Eid al-Adha: When is it and where can I celebrate?

image.altText: Muslim pilgrims at the annual hajj pilgrimage in Mecca

items.synopsis: More than 2 million people are expected to complete the Hajj pilgrimage, an annual ritual Muslims have kept up over centuries. Here's how the tradition lives on, even through wars and plagues.

title.children: Hajj pilgrimage numbers are set to hit a post-COVID record. Here's what the ritual means to Muslims
